Hot Rod client configuration API.

    Method
    Description
    SslConfigurationBuilder
    SslConfigurationBuilder.ciphers(String... ciphers)
    Configures the ciphers Setting this property also implicitly enables SSL/TLS (see enable()

    Disables the SSL support
    SslConfigurationBuilder

    Enables the SSL support
    SslConfigurationBuilder

    Enables or disables the SSL support
    SslConfigurationBuilder
    SslConfigurationBuilder.hostnameValidation(boolean hostnameValidation)
    Configures whether to enable hostname validation according to RFC 2818.
    SslConfigurationBuilder
    SslConfigurationBuilder.keyAlias(String keyAlias)
    Sets the alias of the key to use, in case the keyStore contains multiple certificates.
    SslConfigurationBuilder
    SslConfigurationBuilder.keyStoreCertificatePassword(char[] keyStoreCertificatePassword)
    Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
    since 9.3
    SslConfigurationBuilder
    SslConfigurationBuilder.keyStoreFileName(String keyStoreFileName)
    Specifies the filename of a keystore to use to create the SSLContext You also need to specify a keyStorePassword(char[]).
    SslConfigurationBuilder
    SslConfigurationBuilder.keyStorePassword(char[] keyStorePassword)
    Specifies the password needed to open the keystore You also need to specify a keyStoreFileName(String).
    SslConfigurationBuilder
    SslConfigurationBuilder.keyStoreType(String keyStoreType)
    Specifies the type of the keystore, such as JKS or JCEKS.
    SslConfigurationBuilder
    SslConfigurationBuilder.protocol(String protocol)
    Configures the secure socket protocol.
    SslConfigurationBuilder
    SslConfigurationBuilder.provider(String provider)
    Configures the SSL provider.

    Specifies the TLS SNI hostname for the connection

    Specifies a pre-built SSLContext
    SslConfigurationBuilder
    SslConfigurationBuilder.trustStoreFileName(String trustStoreFileName)
    Specifies the filename of a truststore to use to create the SSLContext You also need to specify a trustStorePassword(char[]).
    SslConfigurationBuilder
    SslConfigurationBuilder.trustStorePassword(char[] trustStorePassword)
    Specifies the password needed to open the truststore You also need to specify a trustStoreFileName(String).
    SslConfigurationBuilder

    Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
    since 12.0 to be removed in 15.0.
